bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Helen Cassidy, February 4, 1953

div1.p: Hench is sending Cassidy a description of the Camp Lazear dedication and a copy of the speech he gave.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Helen Cassidy, February 4, 1953
div1.p:
Enclosed please find two items - a description of the dedication in the
form of a letter which I sent to the survivors and relatives of survivors
of those memorialized and the long version of the talk that I gave at the
dedication. I cannot at the moment find a copy of the short version of
the talk that I gave at the dedication, but if you actually need it we
can make an ozalid copy.

It will be a month before I can finish the pressing obligations which I
now have and can start preparing a little talk for staff regarding the
dedication of this new medical shrine. Meanwhile if you wish to see some
of the newspaper clippings from Havana (including an English-speaking Havana
paper) and some photographs I have quite a collection at home.

I appreciate your postponing the appearance of anything on this in the
Mayovox until I have had a chance to present it at staff. I know that
the Mayovox cannot give more than a short article on this matter and you
may wish to go ahead with its preparation from the enclosed material.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Not sending Confidential Memo.
